channel.title: Shift function
channel.description: how do i use the shift function? i need to use shift to get "::" in the line. heres the line, i have about 30 lines that i need the shift key[scar]message1='::pickup 1038 1';[/scar] could someone fix this? i have 30 lines that need it...and i dont want to use the sendkeyVB because i cant script...

item.title: Shift function
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

[code]program New;
{Auto item spawner for moparscape by deoxys505}
{.include srl/srl.scar}

const
message1=’::pickup 1038 1’;
message2=’::pickup 2414 1’;
message3=’::pickup 4587 1’;
message4=’::pickup 3140 1’;
message5=’::pickup 1187 1’;
message6=’::pickup 4087 1’;
message7=’::pickup 2904 1’;
message8=’::pickup 2912 1’;
message9=’::pickup 3486 1’;
message10=’::pickup 3481 1’;
message11=’::pickup 3483 1’;
message12=’::pickup 3488 1’;
message13=’::pickup 2922 1’;
message14=’::pickup 1040 1’;
message15=’::pickup 4151 1’;
message16=’::pickup 0391 999999999’;
message17=’::pickup 2914 1’;
message18=’::pickup 0995 999999999’;
message19=’::pickup 2623 1’;
message20=’::pickup 2629 1’;
message21=’::pickup 2621 1’;
message22=’::pickup 2627 1’;
message23=’::pickup 2625 1’;
message24=’::pickup 2619 1’;
message25=’::pickup 2615 1’;
message26=’::pickup 1046 1’;
message27=’::pickup 1048 1’;
message28=’::pickup 2617 1’;
message29=‘deoxys505’;
message30=‘sonic’;

procedure TypeSend2(Text: String);
var
i: Integer;
cap: String;

begin
cap := ‘~!@#$%^&*()_+{}|QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKL:"ZXCVBNM<>?’;
for i := 1 to Length(Text) do
begin
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
KeyDown(VK_SHIFT);
Wait(20+Random(50));
end;
TypeByte(GetKeyCode(Text[i]));
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
Wait(20+Random(50));
KeyUp(VK_SHIFT);
end;
Wait(50 + Random(120));
end;
wait(200 + Random(500));
TypeByte(13);
end;

procedure m0;
begin
Typesend2(message29);
Typesend2(message30);
wait(7500)
Typesend2(message1);
Typesend2(message2);
Typesend2(message3);
Typesend2(message4);
Typesend2(message5);
Typesend2(message6);
Typesend2(message7);
Typesend2(message8);
Typesend2(message9);
Typesend2(message10);
Typesend2(message11);
Typesend2(message12);
Typesend2(message13);
Typesend2(message14);
Typesend2(message15);
Typesend2(message16);
Typesend2(message17);
Typesend2(message18);
Typesend2(message19);
Typesend2(message20);
Typesend2(message21);
Typesend2(message22);
Typesend2(message23);
Typesend2(message24);
Typesend2(message25);
Typesend2(message26);
Typesend2(message27);
Typesend2(message28);
end;

begin
m0
end.[/code]

Fixed.

item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

…can you post as a script…as an atachment…please. then i can copy and paste…[br][size=1]Posted at: December 13, 2006, 10:47:25 PM[/size][hr]not working…heres full script with your edit
[scar]program {Auto item spawner for moparscape by deoxys505}
{.include srl/srl.scar}

const
message1=’::pickup 1038 1’;
message2=’::pickup 2414 1’;
message3=’::pickup 4587 1’;
message4=’::pickup 3140 1’;
message5=’::pickup 1187 1’;
message6=’::pickup 4087 1’;
message7=’::pickup 2904 1’;
message8=’::pickup 2912 1’;
message9=’::pickup 3486 1’;
message10=’::pickup 3481 1’;

message12=’::pickup 3488 1’;
message13=’::pickup 2922 1’;
message14=’::pickup 1040 1’;
message15=’::pickup 4151 1’;
message16=’::pickup 0391 999999999’;
message17=’::pickup 2914 1’;
message18=’::pickup 0995 999999999’;
message19=’::pickup 2623 1’;
message20=’::pickup 2629 1’;
message21=’::pickup 2621 1’;
message22=’::pickup 2627 1’;
message23=’::pickup 2625 1’;
message24=’::pickup 2619 1’;
message25=’::pickup 2615 1’;
message26=’::pickup 1046 1’;
message27=’::pickup 1048 1’;
message28=’::pickup 2617 1’;
message29=‘deoxys505’;
message30=‘sonic’;

procedure TypeSend2(Text: String);
var
i: Integer;
cap: String;

begin
cap := ‘~!@#$%^&*()_+{}|QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKL:"ZXCVBNM<>?’;
for i := 1 to Length(Text) do
begin
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
KeyDown(VK_SHIFT);
Wait(20+Random(50));
end;
TypeByte(GetKeyCode(Text[i]));
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
Wait(20+Random(50));
KeyUp(VK_SHIFT);
end;
Wait(50 + Random(120));
end;
wait(200 + Random(500));
TypeByte(13);
end;

procedure m0;
begin
Typesend2(message29);
Typesend2(message30);
wait(7500)
Typesend2(message1);
Typesend2(message2);
Typesend2(message3);
Typesend2(message4);
Typesend2(message5);
Typesend2(message6);
Typesend2(message7);
Typesend2(message8);
Typesend2(message9);
Typesend2(message10);
Typesend2(message11);
Typesend2(message12);
Typesend2(message13);
Typesend2(message14);
Typesend2(message15);
Typesend2(message16);
Typesend2(message17);
Typesend2(message18);
Typesend2(message19);
Typesend2(message20);
Typesend2(message21);
Typesend2(message22);
Typesend2(message23);
Typesend2(message24);
Typesend2(message25);
Typesend2(message26);
Typesend2(message27);
Typesend2(message28);
end;

begin
m0
end.
[/scar]

item.title: Shift function
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Ok, add this procedure into the script, like right after the constants:

[scar]procedure TypeSend2(Text: String);
var
i: Integer;
cap: String;

begin
cap := ‘~!@#$%^&*()_+{}|QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKL:"ZXCVBNM<>?’;
for i := 1 to Length(Text) do
begin
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
KeyDown(VK_SHIFT);
Wait(20+Random(50));
end;
TypeByte(GetKeyCode(Text[i]));
if pos(Text[i], cap) > 0 then
begin
Wait(20+Random(50));
KeyUp(VK_SHIFT);
end;
Wait(50 + Random(120));
end;
wait(200 + Random(500));
TypeByte(13);
end;[/scar]

And then replace the TypeSend’s with TypeSend2.

That should fix it,

-Weibs.

Read full topic

item.title: Shift function
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I’m guessing the script your using uses a typing procedure that doesn’t support capital letters, so you’ll need to modify the typing procedures or use a new typing procedure, so it would help if you could post the script.

But, just for future reference, this is how you would capitalize a key:

[php] KeyDown(VK_SHIFT);
SendKeys(‘a’);
KeyUp(VK_SHIFT);[/php]

Although, SendKeys does support capitals, other procedures may not.

Read full topic
